content: monster pouch approx size 3 in x 3 ½ in supplies cid 2 e hook 3 50mm cid 2 some worsted weight yarn of your choosing i used joann s sensations celebration because it was a good sparkly green monster color ☺ cid 2 a small amount of another worsted weight for the tooth cid 2 2 small and 2 slightly larger buttons for eyes cid 2 needle and thread in an appropriate color pattern cid 2 chain 12 cid 2 skip 1st chain single_crochet in back loop of next 10 chain 2 single_crochet in back loop of last chain working around the other side as in rotate your work 180 2 single_crochet in other loop of last chain worked single_crochet in other loop of next 9 chain on last chain 3 single_crochet should end with 26 single_crochet around the base chain cid 2 single_crochet in front loop of each single_crochet around 26 single_crochet you should have a little rounded rectangular shaped bottom forming turn the bottom inside out this will make the bottom look nicer and will make it easier to continue working at least in my opinion cid 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet 26 single_crochet repeat for total of 15 row of single_crochet about 3 ½ in or you can compare against a credit card or gift card for sizing cid 2 on next row single_crochet in next 13 sts turn 13 single_crochet cid 2 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet across 13 single_crochet turn repeat for total of 7 row button holes cid 2 chain 1 single_crochet 2 chain 3 skip next 3 sts single_crochet 3 chain 3 skip next 3 sts single_crochet 2 turn cid 2 chain 1 single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 3 in chain 3 space single_crochet in next 3 sts single_crochet 3 in chain 3 space single_crochet in last 2 sts turn 13 single_crochet cid 2 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet across turn 13 single_crochet repeat for 1 more row cid 2 skip 1st single_crochet single_crochet in next 11 across fasten_off tooth cid 2 in another color yarn and working into underside of flap about 1 row from bottom edge cid 2 about 1-2 sts from edge sl chain 1 to attach yarn to work cid 2 single_crochet 5 sts working each single_crochet into the flap be careful not to poke through to the side that will be visible turn cid 2 single_crochet in 2nd single_crochet from hook single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet sl in last single_crochet turn cid 2 single_crochet in 2nd single_crochet from hook single_crochet in next single_crochet sl in last single_crochet turn cid 2 single_crochet in 2nd single_crochet from hook sl in next single_crochet turn cid 2 single_crochet in 2nd single_crochet from hook fasten_off finishing cid 2 for the eyes use take 1 smaller and 1 larger button and put them facing each other cid 2 fold flap over and mark your eye placement with safety pins cid 2 unfold flap and stitch buttons on with some needle &
